comments.body: I love the idea of a mob that stalks you silently. Can you imagine walking through a dark forest and suddenly your dog is barking trying to get your attention that something is wrong?

Yes it would be very challenging indeed, I like the idea of a mob that constantly follows you in the shadows, it follows in the shadows sounds like a challenging mob. Yes I can imagine walking through a forest and then hear my dog barking only to discover something is watching me the in shadows. If y'all add a mob like this please do because it definitely would make the game even more interesting and fun. A mob that can break any type of block sounds challenging to me plus it stalks you? That's very interesting.

Yes it would be nice if the team would add a mob like this to make minecraft into kind of a horror game but not really, with a mob like the shadows it would make the game even more fun and interesting then before.
I don't think glowing sheep would be very useful, if only because I doubt they'll add glowing wool, but glowing armor outside of enchant glint seems neat.
This would be so fun to mess with

Ive wanted deer for so long but now i really do ever since i had a dream i was sitting in a nice little hunting blind in a pine forest on minecraft. The sun was shining through the leaves and there were a couple deer wandering around. Was awesome. 10/10 would be an amazing idea. Just think,whens the last time you saw a cow,chicken,or sheep wandering the forest? Cause i haven't.but i have seen deer. It would add a new food supply thats tricky to catch and add a real feel to the woods by making them more lively and you could startle the deer by running near them. And the antlers would be dope.we could put them in an item frame on the wall above our fireplaces.
good

This sounds like a good idea! Would make fighting the warden a lot more interesting since you'd need to make sure you don't get pushed into lava or onto a bunch of drip stone stalagmites or something... ü§î
Good idea, but it still shouldn't be used to make the Warden fight better, as you shouldn't fight the Warden
The point here is that, when you build 4 blocks up. Warden cant do anything, so it roars and pushes you off a tower. Great idea. Hope it gets added.
They should have armor points because of their shell, too. You should also be able to tame them.
Muy buena idea as√≠ ya no solo podemos tener las tipo caracolas pescando o matando a un ahogado
please add hermit crabs i got 3 hermit crabs as a pet
i also think it would be cool if we got some jelly fish, sharks, sea horses, whales
Sardines and mackerel would be great as well. (Also super tasty!)
!!Awesome!! More animals in the forest, Yes Please üëãüòâüëç

Add new hostile mobs in caves. Although the cave generation is great, the lack of lighting there makes it dark, but it would be nice if there were more shiny mobs specific to this negative layer, like zombies with helmets with flashlights, hostile fish in the waters (shiny or not), mini stone golems that disguise themselves in rocks and darkness, bats that for some reason shine, etc.

Centipedes would be cool. I could imagine a type of centipede creature that can split up into each of it's segments and attack separately. Their mandibles would be what connect to each other. They could be called Multipedes
I say put large crabs in the game like in the Elder Scrolls games. :D
Good idea!
You can get some leads and bring golems with you, you don't need personal guards.

I need this, it's perfect for medieval structures and castles or bases.

Very good idea.
This is a great idea, especially with how many drowned there are in a concentrated area as compared to other hostile mobs on land.
I don't think they should scare zombies but scaring drowned is a cool idea.

Such a brilliant concept!

I uphold that idea, because of 'exhaustion' of existing lands for mining.

Once you exploit a place for mining that place may NOT have any more production of ores, except some cases.
here is an idea. to get a pegasus you should feed a horse 3 enchanted apples in a 10 second time frame.
I think each Minecraft game should be unique and that the Redstone Monstrosity should stay in Minecraft Dungeons...
You know, this really isn‚Äôt a bad idea!  Besides aged copper, this feature could also add history to your Minecraft worlds!

This seems like a really good idea! Also gives it more functionality and makes people not regret choosing it so much.

I will say, though, it does limit its spawning regions since it wouldn't survive in biomes without them (e.g. dark waters, like seen in the new caves.) I think it'd work out more if the food choice was expanded - Maybe the new moss/grass in lush caves would do?
you have a good point ggtylerr

I think that the glow squids should actually glow and the glow pulses kind of like the heart on the warden.

Also another thing you should add is a glowing ink sack that you can make into dye so you can dye your beds and make them glow but I don't know it might not get added anyways so
ggtylerr They could eat glow lichen to keep their glow, but to prevent caves from becoming too dark, the glow lichen would grow back after eaten.
I agree
I agree with this post. I think some cave fish would go nicely along side too.

I 100% agree! Another thing to add is perhaps even rework the pre existing bosses to make them more harder, more engaging, more rewarding and fun. For example, the Elder Guardian could perhaps has a new move where it could shoot out its spikes and they sort of home towards you as well has having a new tail whip attack when you get too close. When they die, instead of dropping sponges, since you can already find them in rooms somewhere, and instead drop either a gold block or a new prismarine block that you can only find from elder guardians. Can even add bosses for the progress for the end, for example, add a new nether fortress boss so that end eyes can be crafted from what this boss drops instead of crafting the m from blaze powder from regular blazes. Makes the progress towards the end more challenging and more rewarding.

A cool idea would be to make it so that it elongated the core game instead of the usual just get eyes of ender and thats it. Maybe keep the eyes of ender but you must make an offering to the portal with all of the unique drops from the bosses you must finish before going to the end.

The Necromancer could be the thing the warden is preventing you from spawning (would give a reason for deep dark) and you need to fight him for a piece of his cloak

Piranha Plant type beast also from Dungeons maybe naturally spawning in the Crimson and warped forest biomes. Drops poisoned spore

And the Redstone Golem occasionally spawns a larger arena room inside a mineshaft drops Redstone Dusted Poppy

And then Parity the Wither over to the Java version to make it more difficult. 

So to defeat the game one must prepare for and fight all of the bosses, then find eyes of ender, Place them in the portal and make an offering of unique drops as ‚Äúproof of strength‚Äù (worthy of fighting the dragon) then portal opens up and you fight the dragon for end game loot. 

I have plenty of other Ideas that go along with this as well but I only have 1500 characters so I‚Äôll see if I can comment on my own post.

Boss 1 - Test Through Poison

Similar to Minecraft Dungeons there is a giant Piranha plant Type that is stationary in the middle and spits poison as its first phase. It has health points surrounding it in a circle that the player must destroy before the Boss transforms to its next phase. In which, now the player must move quick enough to not get caught in periodic poison spikes that arise while trying to take out the health points again. The final phase will be Phase one and Two combined. This boss will be located in the Nether in the Crimson or the Warped forest biome. This ‚ÄúPiranha Plant‚Äù will have a naturally generated ‚Äúarena‚Äù that makes it difficult to get out once the fight starts(maybe like a 2-3 block drop into its enclosure so that if it is attacking you, you dont have much time to break the blocks to get out).

Boss 2 - Withering Away

There should be a Parity Update for Java in which the wither gains all of the move sets that the bedrock version has. This includes the charge attack, the random blow up that happens, and spawning wither skeletons when down to a certain HP.

Boss 3 - The Corrupted Redstone Golem

Long ago this golem once helped the ancient civilization mine away and build what was once an amazing city down here. When the civilization had died and all that was left was the golem, he retreated to the mines to which the redstone and iron make up had started to fuse together due to moisture and neglect. A large brute force melee attacking type of monster. Similar to Minecraft dungeons. He starts as a normal hand to hand type fight, but the next phase becomes more difficult as he can smash the ground and make a splash damage effect. The final phase becomes a bit more explosive as he has the ability to leave behind/throw/ignite TNT. This boss will naturally spawn in mines in a new room similar to that big open dirt room in mineshafts already.

Boss 4 - Test Through Darkness

A warden is a being that guards something. I think that something should be the mysterious portal looking thing. But instead of a portal it is a gateway that releases the Necromancer. The Necromancer re-animates dead mobs that have died and formed into the skulk to come back and fight the player on his behalf while the boss fight goes on. The Necromancer should be similar to the Minecraft Dungeons game where he is a ranged attack using a soul bow or something that gets shot at the player(Relies more on the mobs he spawns than the projectiles he throws). He is a flying/floating type (stays remotely close to the ground similar to the wither).

Yes! I think we definitely need at least one other deep dark biome mob, one that is smaller and should be able fit in a smaller hole, because the warden can easily be out-maneuvered if you just retreat into a hole or entryway smaller and it is tall. I imagine this mob having large ears like real-life bat ears and it being black or dark blue instead of gray as you said. Though I suppose it could have two or more color variations in dark grey and dark aqua.
This sounds so cool. I love everything about this except for the ability to see other skulks when it's in your offhand. I think the night-vision portion is awesome though.
I LOVE this idea! Seems very vanilla-y. I hope the devs see this!

Thanks for all the support! I'm excited about how close you are to my vote goal to add audio clips! I want to do something different with the Skulk eye though, You would eat it to gain night vision, but it wouldn't make you invisible in low light, as that is too OP with the high drop rate of the eyes. And as for being able to see the skulks in low light, that should just be an effect after eating the eye, or night vision would allow you to see them normally. I felt like the whole soul fire attraction would give people who have been to the Nether a way to avoid unwanted encounters with this mob, and because I thought it would be a funny quirk. The oldest comment asked why it was gray, and I don't think I did a good job at explaining the appearance, Think something like the bone devil in D&D 5e mixed with a velociraptor. I also didn't mention this, but if you want to rack my brain even more than I did making The Skulker, I will make a new mob suggestion if you can reach a vote goal of 25.
You know what screw it I'm suggesting another mob, I'll put the link in a comment here if you wanna see it

It's done! Check out my newly suggested Ender Vines mob using the link below:

https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/community/posts/360073968192-Ender-Vines
Guess I‚Äôm adding audio clips

I like this idea! But the thing is, what about our deaf players? how will they be able to detect the mob if only detectable by sound? And if they are given the ability to break light sources, what about the naturally generated ores? They might destroy those too before the player can mine them. This is just a suggestion but, maybe they can occasionally radiate small and dim particles when they are invisible, to make it easier for those with hearing disabilities. But I really enjoy your overall idea! Very creative! Underrated man
I think they should be blind like the warden so that people can sneak past them because fighting them would make too much noise and the warden could hear you.

The FrozenStar item can be used to brew Potion of Ice, or any desired name. Drinking a this potion will have the same effect as that of the Iceologer. Making this potion into a splash potion the frozen effect can be given to any mob in the game though some mobs are immune : Ender Dragon, Wither, Skulkers , Endermen, Blaze , Magma Cubes, Ghast, Strays, Iceologer, Iron Golem, Snow Golem.
The same thing goes for mobs that are frozen they won't be able to move nor attack.
The "Ice Protection" enchantment has 4 levels, Level One: Mobs can spot the player from 20 blocks away Frozen effect from the Iceologer lasts 50 seconds.
Level Two: 15 blocks, Frozen effect for 40 seconds.
Level Three: Mobs normal vision distance, Frozen effect for 25 seconds.
Level Four: Mobs normal vision distance, Frozen effect for 15 seconds.
No Ice Protection: 20 Blocks, Frozen effect for 1 minute.

No, just no. Bastions have to be somewhat of a challenge, it's too easy if you can just place a block and have all the brutes just run away. You can already trap them with a boat, which is already op enough.

I like how you are thinking but bastions have good gear in them and the nether is meant to be hard. what is a game where you almost always win. Plus in my opinion it is kind of funny when I lose. The whole point of the nether is to be hard.
Piglin brutes should not hit as hard as they do and have that much health, unless you have netherite there is no way of even killing these mobs even with diamond armour.
I killed Piglin Brutes several times with diamond armor, in my opinion they are not hard to kill.

They shouldn‚Äôt necessarily nerf them, but instead make them look as strong as they are. I mean, they deal as much as an iron golem while carrying golden axes! They should carry netherite axes instead (not droppable of course), so they aren‚Äôt that easily underestimated as they are now :)

and a leather armor as this armor could be dyed in colors like the other leather armor and it would also serve in the powder snow so that the wolves do not freeze in the powder snow.

It is confirmed that wolf armour will be added to the game in 1.21 because the armadillo has won the Mob Vote. We can't speculate, but there is a good chance that there will only be 1 type of armour.

 

We need to watch closely and provide constructive feedback for the Mojang team from this point.

Personally I love it, now I can take my lil buddy around into my adventures, but I personally think less knock back and a bit more armor is needed. The best way of including these things is by using ores to upgrade the armor from what is the base armordillo armor to reinforced armordillo armor, essentially allowing our beloved buddies to stay and aid in battle much longer. Though personally just adding a bit more defense, just a tiny, itty bit more and less knock back would make this armor absolutely PERFECT!
if you take wolf armour and combine it with an ore it should upgrade to that ore
they are venomous
Yes please

Facts about the Platypus:

  • They are nocturnal.
  • They feed on sea life like crayfish and worms.
  • They are hunted by Owls, snakes, eagles and crocodiles.
  • They live in rivers, lakes and lagoons in forests around the eastern part of Australia.
  • They are venomous.
  • They are one of the few species of mammals that lay eggs.
  • They are semiaquatic.
  • They produce milk like sweat.
Hopefully these encourage people to vote for this mob.

Walking source of omlettes. Lets say we cook the egg, milk it, and badaboom. Omlette Time!!! Too bad we can't make toast as well.... Mmm maybe with some butter made from milk (or cheese ???) Minecraft needs some more food and this guy might be a step that way

I would love this. They have so many uses and its unfortunate the post doesn‚Äôt exactly talk about them.

1. Platypuses would be a source of eggs. They lay eggs of course.

2. An ambient river mob. They would be the first mob to exclusively spawn in rivers.

3. They have venomous spurs on their legs. This means that if attacked, they could poison the player (or something similar). They could be classified as a ‚Äúdefensive‚Äù mob like Pufferfish, or even neutral.

4. Gives much more animal diversity to the game. Minecraft has very few animals outside of farm animals, and adding an Australian animal as well as a Monotreme (killing two birds with one stone) would just be awesome.
Tell everyone to vote this

I have 2 options for their usage.

1) You can pet it for binding to the boat for more speed.

2) You can pet it for catching fish for you

Yes! We need platypuses in minecraft! Maybe spawning in savana and jungle river biomes? Adding a new semi-aquatic mob would really improve the game, and rather than being a passive mob, maybe a neutral mob; if you attack it it stings/poisons you. They could be a very cute addition to the game and create burrow blocks, dirt blocks with holes through them that join up. These could be mined using silk touch (normal tools would just give dirt) to give burrow blocks which could be placed to create homes for platypuses. You could also breed them with fish or worms!
Would love to see this ingame!
Also as platypuses are under threat in the wild it would be good to raise awareness ingame
they are endangered species! mojang could add this before platypus is entirely gone on earth ü´Ç
Why don't we have this in the game already?

Spawns: Non-frozen rivers

Behavior: Swim through the water, taking breaths every once and awhile. If you attack or bump a non-tamed one, they poison you. Drowned do not want to be poisoned, and will flee from them. Will swallow gravel, sand, coarse dirt, and clay, but only five blocks for two minutes. If you kill one, it will drop these blocks. They will swallow more blocks if you equip a chest on a tamed one, and you will be able to take out the blocks from the chest. They can store 4 stacks. If you manually give ("feed") them sediment, you may tame them. Tamed platypuses will follow you, sit, or be assigned to a job, though they will automatically follow you. Sitting is the second option. To assign one to a specific block type, you put the block in their inventory by itself. If you put in multiple, they will swallow all of the types specified. If you do not put any in, they will eat one block, and assign themselves to that block. To reassign, you may remove as many blocks as needed and add a stone block or stone variant (blackstone, end stone, netherrack, etc all work). This will clog their chest intake, and they will stop collecting. If you remove every other block and add in a new piece of sediment, they will reset to it. If you remove the stone block, they will then continue with the new job. If you remove all blocks and remove the stone immediately, they will go back to collecting all blocks. They are faster, and faster at mining, in water. They can be affected by haste.
Platypuses (no, its not platypi) are my favorite animal. Weird an adorable, and very interesting creatures. I think they would be a great addition to the game!

And there could be a rare version that is blue like

Parry Parry the platypus

I almost never come across an idea for a new mob that I like, but this is one of them. You've told us everything we would need to know about the mob, and you've integrated it into the current game very well. Nicely done.

The only suggestion I have to make is that owls should probably prefer to stay above ground. That way, they can only help you on the surface, not caves. It also makes sense considering owl's normal behaviors (or at least, so I think!).
Going forward, lets keep suggestions focused on a single idea per post: https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/articles/360003401232-Posting-Guidelines
Nooooo wait How about the Barn Owls

I really like Ur idea mate. N I would like to add in n suggest another type of owl i.e.- the endangered snowy owl found exclusively in snowy mountains or in snowy Taiga biomes. They may also be given a use once tamed like being able to help communicate with other players by able to carry books signed in the name of the recipient. This would add a whole new perspective towards multiplayer gaming...
I think a good owl to use for the desert would be a burrowing owl.
More birds in the game would be great!

oh I wrote about the same thing, I didn't realize you had done it too sorry 

ps a good desert owl would be the elf owl

Owls: these should be in taiga biomes, snow biomes and desert biomes. The taiga biome owl would be based around the great horned owl .The snow biome have snowy owls. And in the desert biome have and elf owl, it would be cool if they nested in cacti like they do in their natural habitat so have a different cactus texture that looked like a hole in the cactus and when it turned to night the owl would fly out.They make a hooting noise when not flying and a very, very quiet churr, churr, churr  noise when flying. The big ones would be would be 1.5 blocks high and one block wide either way and the small one (Elf owl in desert) would be one block high and one block wide either way. They would attack rabbits on sight and you will be able to tame them with rabbit meat  and if you do they can bring you rabbit meat if they are in the right biome, sort of like foxes. After you tame them you can make them perch on your shoulder like you do parrots. If you are in the right biome to get rabbits, make the owl perch on your shoulder and then send it out hunting, it will only do so at a specific time of day (in the dawn/dusk hours) and then it will bring you back rabbit meat in about 30 sec-2 mins and then it will land in front of you and drop the rabbit meat. The reason I want them is that I think that they will be a nice addition to the game adding a nice atmosphere being useful by being tamed.

So I hope you add owls and this made sense, so goodbye for the present
I love owls maybe barn owls in villages?
I see people talking about Barn Owls, why not have them spawn only in villages in and around the forests? Or maybe near the woodland mansion? Just food for thought :)
I really like this idea since my favourite animal is a owl

I love the idea of the ambient noises they would provide and a more useful flying pet.

Perhaps they could help fight phantoms?
Follow up idea would be to have owls that aren't tamed only fly at night. This providing more reason to be active in the night. If you always sleep it away you won't see them moving around.
I hope this makes the cut. Also, they could just be called owls to get pass what the admin has put on this post. The snowy owls are my favorite in this post!
I love Owls their so cuteüòç

maby barnacles could grow on any wood in or out of water, that way if you are building a pier in minecraft, barnacles would appear on the legs of the pier to add more realism to minecraft, right now minecraft piers are to clean at the moment.
Many ocean live creature
Starfish could be used to brew a potion of sticking, which would allow players to climb vertically on surfaces.
They should be stationary mobs, like shulkers (without the attacks)
Sea urchins can be a mob that is a block but acts like a cactus!

I think barnacles should work like sea pickles where they can stack up to 4 on one block, and when underwater they emit light and their pink feeder legs (called cirri) stick out. Unlike sea pickles, they can generate on any side of the block, but only on "hard" blocks such as stone and wood, not dirt and sand and ice. They can only generate in oceans within 5 blocks of the surface and up to 2 blocks above sea level. That way, you might find barnacle colonies lighting up rocky shores or sunken shipwrecks or tide pools.

I think barnacles should be found on shipwrecks too. It would make shipwrecks seem older, since the ones we usually find are just a pile of broken wood, so they don't look super old. I also think that sea urchins should have a chance of poisoning you, since I'm pretty sure eating sea urchins in real life (if that's actually a thing) is dangerous.
I think the sea floor should be explored more
It would be cool if barnacles could spawn on sea turtles
